Secret societies elitist hamper accountability

Maybe secret societies are just drinking clubs PERIOD But who knows

Maybe secret societies exist just for anonymous recognition of selfless student leaders PERIOD But again who knows

Maybe secret societies work just for the betterment of Penn State and its traditions PERIOD But then again who knows

That is the problem PERIOD Nobody knows PERIOD

Lions Paw Skull  Bones and Parmi Nous remain hidden from public scrutiny PERIOD As a result student leader membership in these societies is marked by elitism hypocrisy and possible conflicts of interest PERIOD In the past these organizations met to establish hidden agendas and work toward secret goals PERIOD The problem of accountability is obvious PERIOD

Now with the election of a student government outsider to the Undergraduate Student Government presidency chances are good that secret societies will again work toward their secret agendas PERIOD Rob Kampia the new Undergraduate Student Government president should be commended for promising not to join a secret society PERIOD

Until  some editors at The Daily Collegian belonged to secret societies  the same editors who made coverage decisions about the student leaders with whom they met PERIOD This same type of conflict can occur with student leaders PERIOD

These societies also promote elitism PERIOD Membership in these groups is often restricted to friends and colleagues of current members who belong to a narrow range of student groups PERIOD

And Lions Paw has the exclusive use of room  in Old Main otherwise known as the  All other rooms in Old Main are used for official University business PERIOD Elitism contradicts the purpose of representative student government which is to represent all students PERIOD

Membership in secret societies is also laden with hypocrisy PERIOD Many of the student leaders in these societies call for more openness from the administration yet meet behind closed doors PERIOD If student leaders expect more openness from others they should start by setting an example PERIOD

Student leaders have an ultimate responsibility to the students they represent PERIOD Being active in secret societies shirks that responsibility PERIOD
